Trial_Design.evidence: patients with locally advanced rectal cancer from 16 tertiary centres who were randomized

Participants.evidence: patients with locally advanced rectal cancer from 16 tertiary centres

Intervention.evidence: randomized for short-term radiotherapy followed by chemotherapy (TNT group) or long-term concurrent chemotherapy group followed by total mesorectal excision

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcomes were overall survival and disease-free survival (DFS).

Number_Randomised.evidence: Among the 451 patients enrolled in the STELLAR trial, 227 patients (50.3%) were assigned to the TNT group

Number_Analysed.evidence: Among the 451 patients enrolled in the STELLAR trial, 227 patients (50.3%) were assigned to the TNT group

Result_Outcome.evidence: Patients in the limited lymphadenectomy subgroup exhibited worse overall survival than those with extended lymphadenectomy (HR 2.95 (95% c.i. 1.47 to 5.92), P = 0.001).
